section.title: Overview
section.para: The rest_client module provides a means of interacting with an HTTP server by doing RESTful queries, such as GET,PUT and POST.

section.title: &osips; Modules
section.para:
The following modules must be loaded before this module:
No dependencies on other &osips; modules..

section.title: External Libraries or Applications
section.para:
The following libraries or applications must be installed before running &osips; with this module loaded:
libcurl.

section.title: connection_timeout (integer)
section.para: Maximum time allowed to establish a connection with the server.

section.title: connect_poll_interval (integer)
section.para: Allows complete control over how quickly we want to detect libcurl's completed TCP handshakes, so the transfers can be started. A lower "connect_poll_interval" will speed up all HTTP transfers, but will also increase CPU usage.

section.title: max_async_transfers (integer)
section.para: Maximum number of asynchronous HTTP transfers a single OpenSIPS worker is allowed to run simultaneously. As long as this threshold is reached for a worker, all new async transfers it attempts to perform will be done in a blocking manner, with appropriate logging warnings.

section.title: curl_timeout (integer)
section.para: Maximum time allowed for the libcurl transfer to complete.

section.title: ssl_verifypeer (integer)
section.para: Set this to 0 in order to disable the verification of the remote peer's certificate. Verification is done using a default bundle of CA certificates which come with libcurl.

section.title: ssl_verifyhost (integer)
section.para: Set this to 0 in order to disable the verification that the remote peer actually corresponds to the server listed in the certificate.

section.title: ssl_capath (integer)
section.para: An optional path for CA certificates to be used for host verifications.
Issues an HTTP GET request to the given 'url', and returns a representation of the resource.
The body_pv pseudo-var will hold the body of the HTTP response.
The optional ctype_pv pseudo-var will contain the value of the "Content-Type:" header.
The optional retcode_pv pseudo-var is used to retain the HTTP status code of the response message. Since the module is based on libcurl, a 0 value means no HTTP reply arrived at all.
Possible parameter types

listitem.para: url - String, pseudo-variable, or a String which includes pseudo-variables. (useful for specifying additional attribute-value fields in the URL)

section.para: This function can be used from the startup, branch, failure, request and timer routes.

example.title: rest_get usage

section.para: Issues an HTTP POST request to the specified url. The request body will be copied from the send_body_pv pseudo-variable. The MIME Content-Type header for the request will be taken from send_ctype_pv (default is "application/x-www-form-urlencoded")

Note that the send_body_pv parameter can also accept a format-string but it cannot be larger than 1024 bytes. For bigger messages, you must build them in a pseudo-variable and pass it to the function.
The mandatory recv_body_pv pseudo-var will hold the body of the HTTP response.
The optional recv_ctype_pv parameter will contain the value of the "Content-Type" header of the response message.

The optional retcode_pv pseudo-var parameter can be given in order to retrieve the HTTP status code of the response message. Since the module based on libcurl, a 0 value means no HTTP reply arrived at all.
Possible parameter types

listitem.para: url, send_body_pv, send_type_pv - String, pseudo-variable, or a String which includes pseudo-variables.

section.para: This function can be used from the startup, branch, failure, request and timer routes.

example.title: rest_post usage

section.para: Issues an HTTP PUT request to the specified url. The request body will be copied from the send_body_pv pseudo-variable. The MIME Content-Type header for the request will be taken from send_ctype_pv (default is "application/x-www-form-urlencoded")

Similar to the rest_post, the send_body_pv parameter can also accept a format-string but it cannot be larger than 1024 bytes. For bigger messages, you must build them in a pseudo-variable and pass it to the function.
The mandatory recv_body_pv pseudo-var will hold the body of the HTTP response.
The optional recv_ctype_pv parameter will contain the value of the "Content-Type" header of the response message.

The optional retcode_pv pseudo-var parameter can be given in order to retrieve the HTTP status code of the response message. Since the module based on libcurl, a 0 value means no HTTP reply arrived at all.
Possible parameter types

listitem.para: url, send_body_pv, send_type_pv - String, pseudo-variable, or a String which includes pseudo-variables.

section.para: This function can be used from the startup, branch, failure, request and timer routes.

example.title: rest_put usage

section.para: Appends 'txt' to the HTTP headers of the subsequent request. Multiple headers can be appended by making multiple calls before executing a request.
The contents of txt should adhere to the specification for HTTP headers (ex. Field: Value)
Parameter types

listitem.para: txt - String, pseudo-variable, or a String which includes pseudo-variables. (useful for specifying additional attribute-value fields in the URL)

section.para: This function can be used from the startup, branch, failure, request and timer routes.
